bibl.title: Who Founded the Indo-Greek Era of 186/5 B.C.E.?
bibl.note: Bactrian history. - Dated Indo-Greek inscriptions (suggesting 157/156 B.C. as the date of the Amphipolis skin text [P. Coll. privées; edd.: Willy CLARYSSE and Dorothy J. THOMPSON, Two Greek Texts on Skin from Hellenistic Bactria, ZPE 159 (2007) pp. 273-279, No. 1]). - Definition of a Hellenistic era. - Possible candidates. - Proliferation of the Indo-Greek era.
bibl.seg: JAKOBSSON Jens, Who Founded the Indo-Greek Era of 186/5 B.C.E.?

Bactrian history. - Dated Indo-Greek inscriptions (suggesting 157/156 B.C. as the date of the Amphipolis skin text [P. Coll. privées; edd.: Willy CLARYSSE and Dorothy J. THOMPSON, Two Greek Texts on Skin from Hellenistic Bactria, ZPE 159 (2007) pp. 273-279, No. 1]). - Definition of a Hellenistic era. - Possible candidates. - Proliferation of the Indo-Greek era.
